stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.

Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.

preGame:
Step right up, sports fans, ghouls, and gladiators of Osterra! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the dizzying heights of the High-Pass Pitch! We are perched so high in the Oread's Summit that the air is thinner than a warlock's apology, but the excitement is thicker than a mountain troll's hide! Today‚Äôs Tuesday Night Trollball clash features the home-turf terrors, The Oread's Summit Tamers, squaring off against the high-society bruisers from the Guild of the Black Sky, The Confluence Captains! It's a real barnburner in the making, and I haven't been this giddy since Morgwae and Artorias busted me out of that dreary Demon Prison! Oh, what a day for a massacre!üéôÔ∏èüî•

Looking at our visiting Oread's Summit Tamers, these Prismatic Troupe favorites are bringing some truly delightful madness to the field. I just saw Odericus Juxon slapping her own helmet until her ears rang‚Äînow that‚Äôs the kind of brain-rattling dedication I love to see! Meanwhile, Alwyn Wandy is over there whispering secret fears into the leather troll head. I hope that head is listening, because it‚Äôs about to have a very rough afternoon! And keep an eye on Edme Virgil, who is currently serenading the mountain goats with a sea shanty so out of tune it‚Äôs practically a war crime! It‚Äôs marvelous! They‚Äôre certainly ready to paint the snow red! üèîÔ∏èüé∂

But don't count out the Confluence Captains, backed by those kissless virgins and money-grubbing priests at the Guild! I spotted Ladew Evelina chugging a raw egg, shell and all‚Äîcalcium is important when you're planning on snapping bones! And look at Belding Chloe, she‚Äôs rubbing the Trollball directly into her armpits for 'grip.' That's the kind of stinking ambition that wins championships, folks! They‚Äôve got the Glowstone Glare on their side, but will it be enough to stop the Tamers from sending them home in pieces? Whether they‚Äôre eating dandelions like Carnahan Laud or wearing boots on the wrong feet like Deach Sharlene, these Captains are ready for a real scrap! Let the carnage begin! ü•öüõ°Ô∏è
postGame:
Gather 'round, you bloodthirsty beauties, for a wrap-up of a game that was truly a feast for the eyes and a famine for the faint of heart! The Confluence Captains have defended their honor and their wallets with a narrow 3-2 victory over the Oread's Summit Tamers! It was a symphony of splinters and screams that would make even my old boss, Lord Orzalon, crack a smile in his cell! The Guild boys might be stuck-up, but they sure know how to swing a lance when the Glowstone starts to shine! üèÜüí•

The action kicked off with a bang when Vonni Geoff absolutely leveled Kass Fogel, sending the Tamer to the sidelines for a quick chat with the afterlife! Carn Tibbetts had to work overtime early just to keep the Tamers on the field. I tell you, there‚Äôs nothing more refreshing than the sound of a Voulge hitting the turf and a player hitting it harder! The Confluence crowd was roaring, probably because they had bets on the first drop of blood! ü©∏üèüÔ∏è

But the Tamers weren't just here for the scenery! Despite being bullied by the Captains‚Äô defense, they kept coming back for more punishment. Mitran Mariand was a favorite target today, getting absolutely crunched not once, but twice by Belding Chloe! That Chloe is a real menace with a lance, and I suspect that armpit-rubbing ritual gave her the 'musk of destiny' needed to dominate the mid-field! It was a beautiful display of organized violence that would make any demon weep with joy! ‚öîÔ∏èüò≠

Our first score came from the Captains‚Äô own Behl Berstine, who decided that running was better than fighting for a moment! Berstine tore through the defense and dunked that troll head right into the goal like it was a pile of gold coins! The Guild of the Black Sky must be thrilled‚ÄîI bet Brennen Farno is counting the potential profits from the commemorative tapestries already! It was a 1-0 lead going into the half that felt like a punch to the gut for the mountain folk! üèÄüî•

After a quick halftime to sweep up the teeth and regrow some limbs, the Captains came out swinging again! Belding Chloe, not content with just injuring people, decided to show off her arm. She took a shot from Center Field that sailed through the air like a cursed raven, scoring a massive 2 points! That's how you do it, folks! 3-0 for the home team, and the Tamers looked like they were ready to start reciting their grocery lists in despair! üéØ‚ú®

But wait! Zadoc Wyatan of the Tamers wasn't ready to let the Guild have all the fun! In a desperate surge from the Away Field, Wyatan launched a beautiful shot that found the bottom of the basket for 2 points! Suddenly it was 3-2, and the mountain air was electric with the possibility of an upset! If only Swamy Ahasuerus had dipped her hands in colder water, maybe they could have found that final point, but the Captains‚Äô defense held firm like a locked vault! üèîÔ∏èüôå

I must give a shout-out to Clippard Burr, who managed to put Caves Cestar out of commission late in the game! It‚Äôs always nice to see the underdog get a few good licks in before the whistle blows. It‚Äôs a shame Cinnemon wasn't here to read the rulebook to them‚Äîmaybe they would have realized they needed to score one more time! But alas, the clock is a cruel mistress, even in a world where death is just a temporary inconvenience! ‚è≥üíÄ

So, the Confluence Captains walk away with the win! I‚Äôm sure Nikos Thanae is out in the streets celebrating by shooting at pigeons or whatever it is that 'benevolent' fellow does for fun. The Tamers are heading back up the mountain with nothing but bruised egos and a few extra holes in their jerseys. It‚Äôs a tough loss for the Prismatic Troups, but that‚Äôs the beauty of Trollball‚Äîthere‚Äôs always next Tuesday to lose a limb! üé≠üö©

As for our 'heroes' of the realm, I didn't see Sir Randy or his fancy bow doing much to help today. Probably too busy polishing his arrows to get his hands dirty in a real sport! And where was Artorias? Likely off being a celebrity somewhere instead of enjoying a good old-fashioned head-butting. You lot really missed out on a spectacle of the highest order! The Everwar might be eternal, but a 3-2 nail-biter is a memory that sticks! üèπüôÑ

No open bar tonight, which is a crying shame because I think Saloma Talich had the tolerance to drink the entire stadium under the table! We‚Äôll have to settle for the intoxication of pure, unadulterated carnage! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the High-Pass Pitch! Join us next week when we‚Äôll see if anyone can actually keep their head on their shoulders for more than ten minutes! Stay brutal, Osterra! üéôÔ∏èüñ§
